uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player

Class Logo

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player.Logo

  • public final class Logo
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder for a Logo.

    Use like this, with a static import of logo(): 

       logo()
     .opacity(200)
     .location(100, 100)
     .file("logo.png")
     .enable()
     .apply(mediaPlayer)
   ;

      • file

        public Logo file(java.lang.String file)
        Apply the logo file.

        It is possible to simply specify the name of the file, or the extended syntax supported by libvlc - e.g. "file,d,t;file,d,t;...", see libvlc_video_logo_option_t.libvlc_logo_file.

        Parameters:
        file - name of the file
        Returns:
        this

      • file

        Apply the logo file.
        Parameters:
        file - logo file
        Returns:
        this

      • image

        public Logo image(java.awt.image.RenderedImage image)
        Apply the logo image.

        This is not optimal as the image must first be written to disk in a temporary file.

        Parameters:
        image - logo image
        Returns:
        this

      • enable

        public Logo enable(boolean enable)
        Apply the initial enabled/disabled state.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the logo; false to disable it
        Returns:
        this

      • disable

        public Logo disable()
        Disable the logo.
        Returns:

      • apply

        public void apply(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer)
        Apply the logo to the media player.

        All previously applied properties will be set on the media player.

        Parameters:
        mediaPlayer - media player
